critique: This document is an executive order withdrawing land from settlement pending legislation. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt, immigration approach, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to have a neutral stance on social inclusion. It could be argued that it expands executive power slightly by withdrawing land, but it also acknowledges the role of Congress. It also seems to favor federal control over state control since the order is acting on land in Oregon. It is difficult to assess the economic regulation aspect, but it could be argued that it is a slight intervention by withdrawing land from settlement.
